property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={40, 172, 1400, 724}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value: Author: Hokeun Kim

property.name: text
property.value:
NOTE: To run this demo, an open-source local authorization entity (Auth) should be running. The Auth can be obtained in the github repository, https://github.com/iotauth/iotauth.
See https://github.com/iotauth/iotauth/blob/master/examples/README.md or click on this annotation.
NOTE2: The parameter IOTAUTH_HOME in this demo should be set to the repository directory of iotauth.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor is used for accessing authorization service provided by a local authorization entity, Auth (https://github.com/iotauth/iotauth), and for secure communication with a SecureCommserver.

Specifically, this accessor establishes a secure communication with server using session keys (symmetric cryptographic keys) and sends/receives messages to/from the server. To obtain session keys, this accessor also communicates with the local authorization entity, Auth.

This accessor internally manages the credentials (cryptographic keys) for communication with remote Auth and remote server. All the messages to/from remote Auth and server are protected using the credentials, while input/output data of this accessor is in plain text.

This accessor requires the 'iotAuth', and 'dataConverter' modules.

property.name: author
property.value: Hokeun Kim

property.name: clientName (parameter)
property.value: The client's unique name in string.

property.name: authHost (parameter)
property.value: Auth's IP address or domain name.

property.name: authCertPath (parameter)
property.value: The path for the X.509 certificate file (in pem format) of Auth with which the client is registered.

property.name: clientPrivateKeyPath (parameter)
property.value: The path for the pem format private key of the client.

property.name: publicKeyCryptoSpec (parameter)
property.value: The specification for the public cryptography algorithms to be used for communication with Auth

property.name: distributionCryptoSpec (parameter)
property.value: The specification for the symmetric cryptography algorithms to be used for communication with Auth

property.name: targetServerGroup (parameter)
property.value: The communication policy group to which the target server belong.

property.name: sessionCryptoSpec (parameter)
property.value: The specification for the symmetric cryptography algorithms to be used for communication with the server

property.name: receiveType (parameter)
property.value: Data type of the received data from server.

property.name: sendType (parameter)
property.value: Data type of the sent data to server.

property.name: authPort (parameter)
property.value: Auth's port number.

property.name: numKeysPerRequest (parameter)
property.value: The number of session keys to be requested per session key request to Auth

property.name: serverHostPort (port)
property.value: Information of the destination server. This input triggers a secure connection with a server (possibly using the SecureCommServer accessor). This input is specified as a JSON with two properties, 'host' and 'port'. The property 'host' specifies the IP address or domain name of server in string and 'port' specifies the port number in integer. If a session key for communicating with a server is not available, the SecureCommClient communicates with Auth to request the session key(s) for secure communication, before establishing a secure connection with the server.

property.name: toSend (port)
property.value: The data to be sent over the secure connection with the server.

property.name: connected (port)
property.value: Output `true` on connected and `false` on disconnected with the server over a secure connection.

property.name: received (port)
property.value: The data received from the server over a secure connection.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor is used for accessing authorization service provided by a local authorization entity, Auth (https://github.com/iotauth/iotauth), and for secure communication with a SecureCommClient.

Specifically, this access listens to secure communication requests from clients and handles the client requests.

This accessor internally manages the credentials (cryptographic keys) for communication with remote Auth and remote client.

All the messages to/from remote Auth and client are protected using the credentials, while input/output data of this accessor is in plain text.

This accessor requires the 'iotAuth', and 'dataConverter' modules.

property.name: author
property.value: Hokeun Kim

property.name: serverName (parameter)
property.value: The server's unique name in string.

property.name: authHost (parameter)
property.value: Auth's IP address or domain name.

property.name: authCertPath (parameter)
property.value: The path for the X.509 certificate file (in pem format) of Auth with which the server is registered.

property.name: serverPrivateKeyPath (parameter)
property.value: The path for the pem format private key of the server.

property.name: publicKeyCryptoSpec (parameter)
property.value: The specification for the public cryptography algorithms to be used for communication with Auth

property.name: distributionCryptoSpec (parameter)
property.value: The specification for the symmetric cryptography algorithms to be used for communication with Auth

property.name: sessionCryptoSpec (parameter)
property.value: The specification for the symmetric cryptography algorithms to be used for communication with the client

property.name: receiveType (parameter)
property.value: Data type of the received data from client.

property.name: sendType (parameter)
property.value: Data type of the sent data to client.

property.name: serverPort (parameter)
property.value: Server's port number.

property.name: authPort (parameter)
property.value: Auth's port number.

property.name: connection (port)
property.value: Includes information of the remote client

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={44, 23, 499, 208}, maximized=false}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Display data using util.inspect() to render a more human-readable form. Any data accepted by util.inspect() can be displayed. The title may be used by the host to label the output in some way, either by labeling a display window or prepending the printed text with the title. The resulting text is passed through to the output in case a model wishes to ensure that the image has been displayed before something else happens or the model wishes to use the rendered text in some way.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The text to display.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: The text to display.

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={544, 23, 499, 208}, maximized=false}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: correctValues
property.value: {"PtClient message # 0", "PtClient message # 1", "PtClient message # 2", "PtClient message # 3", "PtClient message # 4", "PtClient message # 5"}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: Compare the input with a known good input. If you set ''trainingMode'' to true and provide inputs, then the inputs will be recorded in the ''correctValues'' parameters. Otherwise, the inputs will be compared against those in the ''correctValue'' parameter.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks based on the Ptolemy NonStrictTest actor by Paul Whitaker, Christopher Hylands, Edward A. Lee

property.name: input (port)
property.value: The input value.

property.name: output (port)
property.value: False as long as there is data to compare against the input

property.name: correctValues
property.value: {"Server resp #0 to \"PtClient message # 0\"", "Server resp #1 to \"PtClient message # 1\"", "Server resp #2 to \"PtClient message # 2\"", "Server resp #3 to \"PtClient message # 3\"", "Server resp #4 to \"PtClient message # 4\"", "Server resp #5 to \"PtClient message # 5\""}
